title: Week in pictures: 25 July-31 July 2020
description: A selection of powerful news photographs taken around the world this week.

title: Leicester Muslims mark second Eid of extended lockdown
description: Leicester's religious leaders and council urge people to pray and celebrate the festival at home.

title: Whaley Bridge dam crisis: What's changed a year on?
description: Residents in Whaley Bridge reflect on last year's dam crisis that threatened to wipe out their town.

title: Black Lives Matter: 'Backlash has been divisive like Brexit'
description: People have been "shocked", "upset" and "drained" by friends' reactions to Black Lives Matter.

title: Bafta TV Awards: The best moments
description: Watch the highlights of a very different Bafta TV Awards, where awards were accepted virtually.

title: Coronavirus: Tracking new outbreaks in the sewers
description: Around 15,000 new cases of the disease have been reported in Spain in the past week.

title: India Atkinson: TikTok disability educator goes viral
description: India Atkinson's videos address misconceptions about a condition that left her without fingers on one hand.

title: Croke Park: Muslims celebrate Eid in the home of Irish sport
description: Islamic leader says event sends a message "to the whole world" that Ireland is a welcoming country.

title: In Pictures: Alan Parker's film legacy
description: A look at some of the most memorable moments from the late director's filmography.

title: Coronavirus: Can I get facial treatment at a beauty salon?
description: As some lockdown easing is delayed in England, how are customers being kept safe?

title: Coronavirus: PM postpones lockdown easing in England
description: Face coverings will also become compulsory in more indoor settings, such as cinemas, from 8 August.

title: PC Andrew Harper's teenage killers jailed
description: PC Harper died from catastrophic injuries when he was dragged for more than a mile behind their car.

title: Fans not allowed to attend sport events
description: Fans will not be allowed to attend the pilot sports events scheduled for this weekend in England after a spike in coronavirus cases.

title: Return of indoor shows delayed
description: Face coverings must also be worn in museums, galleries and cinemas in England from 8 August.

title: Coronavirus: Scots warned to avoid English Covid hotspots
description: The Scottish government says people should cancel any "non-essential" plans to visit parts of northern England.

title: Hong Kong postpones elections for a year 'over virus concerns'
description: The move comes weeks after China imposed a controversial national security law on Hong Kong.

title: Coronavirus infections rising in England
description: A study that involves swabbing a randomly select group of households found positive tests were increasing.

title: Red Bull's Verstappen fastest in first practice at British GP
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen is ahead of Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton in first practice at the British Grand Prix.

title: Coronavirus: 'The spirit of Eid has gone but celebrations continue'
description: Restrictions will not end Eid celebrations despite plans being cancelled, a Muslim leader says.

title: Dermot Kennedy and Paul Mescal create a unique performance in the Natural History Museum.
description: Dermot Kennedy and Paul Mescal create a unique performance in the Natural History Museum that they say wouldn’t have been possible in front of a live audience.

title: Shamima Begum: Bid to return in citizenship fight goes to Supreme Court
description: The Court of Appeal rules her bid to fight for her citizenship in the UK must go to the highest court.

title: Vietnam records first Covid-19 death
description: The country had spent three months without any new infections before an outbreak in Da Nang city.

title: Holiday firm Tui extends suspension of trips to Spain
description: The tour firm cancels trips to Spain until mid-August but adds more holidays to Greece and Turkey.

title: Hulkenberg stands in after Perez catches coronavirus visiting mother
description: Nico Hulkenberg will stand in for Racing Point's Sergio Perez at the British Grand Prix, after the Mexican contracted coronavirus.

title: Rina Sawayama: 'BPI reviewing music prize rules'
description: Rules that stop the singer being eligible for Britain's biggest music prizes will be reviewed, she says.

title: Premier League looking at 'clinical passports' to help get fans back into stadiums
description: The Premier League is looking at "clinical passports" to help get fans back into stadiums to watch matches, says chief executive Richard Masters.

title: Ellen DeGeneres apologises to staff over workplace 'issues'
description: The star is "disappointed" to hear allegations of harassment and intimidation on her chat show.

title: 'We want to keep our foot on the gas' - Lakers' James leads protests as NBA returns
description: Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James calls for his fellow NBA players to "keep our foot on the gas" in the push for racial justice as the season resumes in Orlando.

title: Coronavirus: The shielders turning the word 'vulnerable' on its head
description: As shielding ends for the 'elderly and vulnerable' will the world they are about to be re-enter be less accessible than the one they left four months ago?

title: NBA: Black Lives Matter and basketball’s role in discussion on racism
description: Basketball is perhaps the sport best placed to challenge racial inequality. Is the NBA doing it right?

title: Creeper guitarist: 'I worked on the album from a psychiatric ward'
description: Creeper's guitarist, Ian, was sectioned last year - now they're releasing a new album.

title: Bird in the Sky: The radio play made under a duvet
description: Dramatising this intriguing true story of an Awol airman involved innovation and perseverance.

title: Coronavirus: Why some people want to keep working from home
description: Office workers in England can soon go back to their desks - but many want to keep working remotely.

title: Quiz: Can you answer these six basic questions about coronavirus in the UK?
description: Take this quiz to test your knowledge about coronavirus and the rules and advice about it in the UK

title: 'I helped Black Lives Matter without protesting'
description: Three people share what they have done to support Black Lives Matter without going to protests.

title: Prison launches take-away meal delivery service
description: Brixton prison is taking orders for take-aways from its professional-standard training restaurant.
